Seajs-worker » Index » SeaWorker

Class: SeaWorker

Defined in: src\worker.coffee

Overview

Base class for all workers. A worker class will be instantiate twice , creating one instance running in browser as a RPC interface and the other running in a web worker doing all the work. A web worker will be created and managed by the browser instance.

Class Method Summary

  • . (void) register(worker_class) Register a derived worker class.
  • . (void) config(sea_opts) Config sea.js in worker context
  • . (null or Promise) map(data, service, max_worker_count, callback) Map an Array of data to a new one.
  • . (Object) reduce(data, reducer, state) Boills down a Array of values into a single value.
  • . (Class) extend(proto) Create a derived class
  • . (void) service(name, fn) Short-hand version of SeaWorker.worker_service
  • . (void) inWorker(name, fn) Short-hand version of SeaWorker.worker_method
  • . (void) inBrowser(name, fn) Short-hand version of SeaWorker.browser_method
  • . (void) worker_service(name, fn) Defines a service that runs in worker.
  • . (void) worker_method(name, fn) Defines a method that only exists in worker instance
  • . (void) browser_method(name, fn) Defines a method that only exists in browser instance

Instance Method Summary

  • # (null or Promise) service_name(args, callback) Each worker_service will have a corresponding method defined in browser instance with the same name.

Class Method Details

. (void) register(worker_class)

Register a derived worker class.

Parameters:

  • worker_class ( class ) — the derived worker class

. (void) config(sea_opts)

Config sea.js in worker context

Parameters:

  • sea_opts ( Object ) — sea.js options

See also:

  • Sea.js Configuration (in Chinese)

. (null or Promise) map(data, service, max_worker_count, callback)

Map an Array of data to a new one. Each element is processed by a worker service. Up to max_worker_count workers will be executing in parallel at the same time. Results are returned by callback or promise (if Q is available)

Parameters:

  • data ( Array ) — the data array to be proessed
  • service ( String ) — the name of a worker service
  • max_worker_count ( Interget ) — the maxiumum number of workers running in parallel

Options Hash: (callback):

  • callback ( Function ) — the optional (if Q is available) callback

Returns:

  • null or Promise

. (Object) reduce(data, reducer, state)

TODO: Provide asynchronized version that runs in worker
Note: This method is synchronized and runs on callsite

Boills down a Array of values into a single value. state is the inital state of the reduction, and each succeesive step of it should be returned by reducer. The reducer is passed four arguments:

  • state
  • value
  • index
  • reference to the entire Array (a.k.a. data)

Parameters:

  • data ( Array ) — the data array to be reduced
  • reducer ( Function ) — the reducer
  • state ( Object ) — the initial state

Returns:

  • ( Object ) — the reduced value

. (Class) extend(proto)

Note: For JavaScript

Create a derived class

Examples:

Create a worker class in JavaScript 

var Derived = SeaWorker.extend({
  field: 'I am a field',
  method: function () {
    // I'm a function exists in both worker and browser
  },
  constructor: function (n) {
    this.n = n;
    // Call parent constructor if needed
    // this.__super(n);
  }
});

// Worker side methods
Derived.inWorker("methodInWorkerOnly", function() {});

// Browser side methods
Derived.inBrowser("methodInBrowserOnly", function() {});

// Worker service, running in worker, called from browser
Derived.service("foo", function() {});

Parameters:

  • proto ( Object ) — Derived class prototype

Returns:

  • Class

  • fn ( Function ) — the function body

Constructor Details

# (void) constructor()

Instance Method Details

# (null or Promise) service_name(args, callback)

Each worker_service will have a corresponding method defined in browser instance with the same name. The same argument list is identical to the service, plus one optional callback. It serves as a RPC interface. The callback should be in the form of (err, result) -> This class also works with Q. When Q is detected, a promise object will be returned.

Parameters:

  • args ( ArgumentList ) — the arguments

Options Hash: (callback):

  • the ( Callback ) — callback

Returns:

  • null or Promise
